div.p: BIRTHPOSITION is an optional sub-element located within BIOGRAPHY BIRTH . It captures information about a writer's position within her family. In systematically capturing information about BIRTHPOSITION, we are providing material for investigating its influence, especially in relation to gender position. It has values Eldest, Youngest, or Only. Choice of attribute value may be a judgement call in face of blended families or siblings dying very young. Bear in mind the way this attribute value reflects conditions of a writerâ€™s childhood. Such statements as "She was the middle one of five daughters" may be included in the CHRONPROSE recording her birth or may be placed in a SHORT-PROSE element following the CHRONSTRUCT.

div.codeblock: <BIRTH><CHRONSTRUCT><DATE>1976</DATE><CHRONPROSE> HB was born.<CHRONPROSE<BIRTHPOSITION POSITION=eldest>She was the eldest of five daughters.</DATE></CHRONSTRUCT></BIRTH>

div.p: Pay attention to the attributes and include where possible, preferably within a sentence, though an empty BIRTHPOSITION element with the attribute of eldest is also possible.
Question: If all I know is that she was the eldest of five daughters, how and where do I include this in the biography?
Answer: If possible, construct a sentence including this information and place in the CHRONPROSE or following a SHORT-PROSE.
